name: For Trivia Enthusiasts Online Trivia | Mixed 25 Questions | 25 Questions

questions.text: Which comic character's friends include Edward Trunk and Bill Badger?
questions.explanation:
Rupert Bear.

	A nice highbrow one to begin with!

questions.text: How many of the following are Italian airports: Cristoforo Colombo, Leonardo Da Vinci, Marco Polo and Galileo Galilei?
questions.explanation:
All four.

	Cristoforo Colombo (Genoa), Leonardo Da Vinci (Rome), Marco Polo (Venice) and Galileo Galilei (Pisa)

questions.text: What is the chemical symbol for plutonium?
questions.explanation:
Pu.

	Certainly not elementary.

questions.text: Which country was previously called the 'Gilbert Islands'?
questions.explanation: Kiribati.

questions.text: In which Dicken's novel would you meet John Jasper, Mr. Honeythunder and Mr. Tartar?
questions.explanation: The Mystery of Edwin Drood.

questions.text: Which musical does the song Zip-a-Dee-Doo-Dah come from?
questions.explanation: Song Of The South.

questions.text: Who was the Roman God of Time?
questions.explanation:
Saturn.

	Chronos was the Greek God of Time

questions.text: Whose horse was called Black Agnes?
questions.explanation:
Mary Queen of Scots.

	Don Quixote rode Rosinante, Richard II rode Barbary Roan and Richard III rode White Surrey.

questions.text: Which boxer's nickname was the 'Boston Gob'?
questions.explanation: Jack Sharkey.

questions.text: Which was NOT an opera by Mozart?
questions.explanation:
A Masked Ball.

	A Masked Ball was by Verdi.

questions.text: In collective nouns terminology, what is a 'descent', a group of?
questions.explanation:
Woodpeckers.

	Array of hedgehogs, Labour or Movement of moles and an ambush of tigers.

questions.text: Which of the 'Ten Commandments' says 'Thou shalt not kill'?
questions.explanation: Sixth.

questions.text: What is the name of the cocktail of Scotch and Drambuie?
questions.explanation: Rusty Nail.

questions.text: Which of the following birthstones are not used for both a month of the year and a sign of the zodiac?
questions.explanation:
Opal.

	Amethyst is used for February and Sagittarius, agate for June and Scorpio, topaz for November and Taurus whereas opal is only used for October.

questions.text: How many chapters are there in 'Genesis', the first book of the bible?
Which book of the Old Testament does NOT exist?
questions.explanation:
Second Corinthians.

	Second Corinthians appears in the New Testament. Halleluiah if you got that one right!

questions.text: Which artist had the forename Michelangelo?
questions.explanation: Caravaggio.

questions.text: Spheksophobia is the fear of _________ ?
questions.explanation: Wasps.

questions.text: Whose paintings include 'The Beheading of Saint John the Baptist', 'David with Goliath's Head' and 'Sick Bacchus'?
questions.explanation: Caravaggio.

questions.text: Anser Anser is the scientific name for which bird?
questions.explanation:
Greylag Goose.

	Hope you got the right answer!

questions.text: The Nine Muses were the daughters of Zeus and ______ ?
questions.explanation:
Mnemosyne.

	I've never heard of her either, no wonder, in Greek Mythology she is the goddess of memory! One to muse over later.

questions.text: Who rode a horse called Lamri?
questions.explanation:
King Arthur.

	Bellerophon rode Pegasus, Caligula rode Incitatus and Sancho Panza rode Dapple.

questions.text: The formation of a word by the imitation of the sound associated with the action or object e.g. buzz, plop or pop is what literary term?
questions.explanation:
Onomatopoeia.

	I knew you would get that one right!

questions.text: Zorro's real name is Don Diego de la Vega. Zorro is Spanish for ____ ?
questions.explanation: Fox.

questions.text: Whose dying words were: 'My soul I resign to god, my body to the earth and my worldly goods to my next of kin'?
questions.explanation:
Michelangelo.

	Not many people like quotations but I hope you enjoyed the quiz even though it was difficult.
